TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ToggleState extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Contains values that specify the ToggleState of a UI Automation element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A control must cycle through its ToggleState in this order: On, Off and if supported, Indeterminate.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState Indeterminate = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The UI Automation element is in an indeterminate state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Indeterminate property can be used to indicate whether the user has acted on a control. For example, a check box can appear checked and dimmed, indicating an indeterminate state.
Creating an indeterminate state is different from disabling the control. Consequently, a check box in the indeterminate state can still receive the focus. When the user clicks an indeterminate control the ToggleState cycles to its next value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState Off = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The UI Automation element is not selected, checked, marked or otherwise activated.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.ToggleState On = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The UI Automation element is selected, checked, marked or otherwise activated.
